page.original:
&ltOBJECT>.ToolbarControlEnable() Syntax &ltOBJECT>.ToolbarControlEnable( Index as N [, Enable as L ] ) ArgumentDescription IndexThe number of the control bar item. The leftmost item is number 1. EnableOptional.
.T. = Enable
.F. = Disable
Description The &ltOBJECT>.ToolbarControlEnable() method applies to:
Browses (for &ltOBJECT> use either the &ltBROWSE> pointer or the name of the browse)
Forms (for &ltOBJECT> use either the &ltFORM> pointer or the name of the form) The &ltOBJECT>.ToolbarControlEnable() method enables or disables the specified item on the control bar. Limitations Desktop applications only. Example dim frm as P frm = form.view("Customer Information") frm.toolbarchange("Query") frm.toolbarcontrolenable(10,.f.)
See Also Form Functions and Methods, Browse Functions and Methods
